wikitext.*:
'''''taure''''' is a [[Quenya]] word meaning "forest".<ref name=PE17>{{PE|17}}, p. 115</ref><ref name=VT>{{VT|39a}}, p. 7</ref><ref>{{L|230}}</ref><ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], [[Nancy Smith]], "[[Index questions]]" (quoted in {{HM|RC}}, p. 385)</ref>

It has been suggested that a standardized spelling of the word would be ''taurë''.<ref>{{S|Appendix}} (the note "[Sindarin] ''taur'' 'wood, forest' (Quenya ''taurë'')" is likely an editorial suggestion by Christopher Tolkien)</ref><ref>[[Helge Fauskanger]], "[http://www.ambar-eldaron.com/quen-eng.pdf Quettaparma Quenyallo]" (accessed 27 February 2011)</ref>

==Etymology==

*[[Sundocarme|Root]] [[TAW|TAW/TAWA]]<ref name=PE17/><ref name=VT/>

==Cognates==
*[[Sindarin]]: ''[[taur]]''

==Examples==
*''[[Tauremorna]]''
*?''[[Oromë#Etymology|Tauron]]''

==Other versions of the legendarium==

In the ''[[The Etymologies|Etymologies]]'', Quenya ''taure'' is glossed as "great wood, forest".<ref>{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 391 (root TÁWAR-)</ref>
